DataFiltering

Hendrilalaina

2025-03-17

1 Packages

library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
library(ggplot2)

2 Data preparation

2.1 Load data

data("diamonds")
summary(diamonds)
##      carat               cut        color        clarity          depth

2.2 Filtering Rows

diamonds[8, ] # 8th row
## # A tibble: 1 × 10
##   carat cut       color clarity depth table price     x     y     z
##   <dbl> <ord>     <ord> <ord>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
## 1  0.26 Very Good H     SI1      61.9    55   337  4.07  4.11  2.53
diamonds[c(2, 12), ] # 2nd and 12th rows
## # A tibble: 2 × 10
##   carat cut     color clarity depth table price     x     y     z
##   <dbl> <ord>   <ord> <ord>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
## 1  0.21 Premium E     SI1      59.8    61   326  3.89  3.84  2.31
## 2  0.23 Ideal   J     VS1      62.8    56   340  3.93  3.9   2.46
diamonds[c(4, 9), 'clarity'] # 4th and 9th rows, column 'clarity'
## # A tibble: 2 × 1
##   clarity
##   <ord>  
## 1 VS2    
## 2 VS2

Filter with filter()

diamonds_filt <- diamonds %>% 
  filter(x > 9) %>%
  filter(cut %in% c('Ideal', 'Premium'))
diamonds_filt
## # A tibble: 24 × 10
##    carat cut     color clarity depth table price     x     y     z
##    <dbl> <ord>   <ord> <ord>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>

Filter with sample_n()

diamonds_filt <- diamonds %>%
  sample_n(20)
diamonds_filt

Filter with slice()

diamonds_filt <- diamonds %>%
  slice(30:45)
diamonds_filt

Filter with top_n()

diamonds_filt <- diamonds %>%
  top_n(5)
## Selecting by z
diamonds_filt
## # A tibble: 5 × 10
##   carat cut       color clarity depth table price     x     y     z
##   <dbl> <ord>     <ord> <ord>   <dbl> <dbl> <int> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
## 1  2    Premium   H     SI2      58.9  57   12210  8.09 58.9   8.06
## 2  4.13 Fair      H     I1       64.8  61   17329 10     9.85  6.43
## 3  5.01 Fair      J     I1       65.5  59   18018 10.7  10.5   6.98

## 5  0.51 Very Good E     VS1      61.8  54.7  1970  5.12  5.15 31.8

2.3 Filter columns

Filter for columns with select()

diamonds_filt <- diamonds %>%
  select(clarity, color) # Only clarity and color columns
diamonds_filt
## # A tibble: 53,940 × 2
##    clarity color
##    <ord>   <ord>
##  1 SI2     E    
##  2 SI1     E    
##  3 VS1     E    
##  4 VS2     I    
##  5 SI2     J    
##  6 VVS2    J    
##  7 VVS1    I    
##  8 SI1     H    
##  9 VS2     E    
## 10 VS1     H    
## # ℹ 53,930 more rows
diamonds_filt <- diamonds %>%
  select(-carat, -price) # All columns except carat and price
diamonds_filt
## # A tibble: 53,940 × 8
##    cut       color clarity depth table     x     y     z
##    <ord>     <ord> <ord>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
